Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
gstack - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Help.Tip: Header word denoting flagged traces.
Help.Text:
gstack - HDR_FLAG
Header word denoting flagged traces.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = 0 - NWIH
 
 If HDR_FLAG = 0 then all traces are processed.  Otherwise only traces with
 a flag set in header word HDR_FLAG are processed.

Help.Tip: Fold of stack exponential method for scaling stacked traces.
Help.Text:
gstack - FSE
Fold of stack exponential method for scaling stacked traces.
 
 Default = 0.5
 Allowed = 0.0-1.0
 
 The Fold of Stack exponential method scales stacked traces by dividing trace
 samples by the number of live traces stacked together raised to the FSE
 power.  The FSE method is time-independent.  FSE = 0.0 does no scaling.

Help.Tip: Mute Scaling method for scaling stacked traces.
Help.Text:
gstack - MSCL
Mute Scaling method for scaling stacked traces.
 
 Default = 0.25
 Allowed = 0.0-1.0
 
 The Mute Scaling method scales stacked traces by multiplying by a complicated
 empirical formula (with no obvious justification) based on maximum fold and
 local time-dependent fold.  Mute scaling is intended to compensate for loss
 of fold due to muting.  MSCL = 0.0 does no scaling.
 
        Scale(MSCL) = 1.0 + MSCL*(((maximum fold)/(actual fold)) - 1.0)

Help.Tip: Time Varying Fold of Stack Exponential method.
Help.Text:
gstack - TVFSE
Time Varying Fold of Stack Exponential method.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = 0.0-1.0
 
 The Time Varying Fold of Stack Exponential method scales stacked traces by
 dividing trace samples by the time varying number of live samples stacked
 together raised to the TVFSE power.  TVFSE = 0.0 does no scaling.  This is an
 industry-standard method.
 
 If TVFSE /= 0.0, then FSE and MSCL methods are disabled.

Help.Tip: Header word containing the X grid coordinate.
Help.Text:
gstack - HDR_X
Header word containing the X grid coordinate.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Minimum CMP X grid location (header word HDR_X).
Help.Text:
gstack - X_INIT
Minimum CMP X grid location (header word HDR_X).
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment between header word HDR_X values for CMP locations.
Help.Text:
gstack - X_INC
Increment between header word HDR_X values for CMP locations.
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.

Help.Tip: Maximum CMP X grid location (header word HDR_X).
Help.Text:
gstack - X_LAST
Maximum CMP X grid location (header word HDR_X).
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 If both X_LAST and X_TOT are specified, X_TOT takes precedence.

Help.Tip: Total number of CMP X grid locations (header word HDR_X).
Help.Text:
gstack - X_TOT
Total number of CMP X grid locations (header word HDR_X).
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int
 
 If both X_LAST and X_TOT are specified, X_TOT takes precedence.

Help.Tip: Header word containing the Y grid coordinate.
Help.Text:
gstack - HDR_Y
Header word containing the Y grid coordinate.
 
 Default = 8
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Minimum CMP Y grid location (header word HDR_Y).
Help.Text:
gstack - Y_INIT
Minimum CMP Y grid location (header word HDR_Y).
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment between header word HDR_Y values for CMP locations.
Help.Text:
gstack - Y_INC
Increment between header word HDR_Y values for CMP locations.
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.

Help.Tip: Maximum CMP Y grid location (header word HDR_Y).
Help.Text:
gstack - Y_LAST
Maximum CMP Y grid location (header word HDR_Y).
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real
 
 If both Y_LAST and Y_TOT are specified, Y_TOT takes precedence.

Help.Tip: Total number of CMP Y grid locations (header word HDR_Y).
Help.Text:
gstack - Y_TOT
Total number of CMP Y grid locations (header word HDR_Y).
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int
 
 If both Y_LAST and Y_TOT are specified, Y_TOT takes precedence.

Help.Tip: Number of traces to keep in a trace buffer.
Help.Text:
gstack - TRACE_BUFFER
Number of traces to keep in a trace buffer.
 
 Default = 100
 Allowed >= 1
 
 A work buffer will be created to store stacked traces as they are being
 composited.  Additional stacked traces will be stored on disk.  Traces that
 are being actively stacked will have preference in the work buffer, with
 traces not being actively stacked moved to a temporary disk file.

Help.Tip: Amount of central memory required in megabytes.
Help.Text:
gstack - MEGABYTES
Amount of central memory required in megabytes.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
gstack - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
gstack - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
gstack - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
gstack - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
gstack - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
gstack - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
gstack - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
gstack - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
gstack - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
gstack - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
gstack - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : GSTACK                     (generalized stack)
 Category   : stacks
 Written    : 2004-11-30   by: Tom Stoeckley
 Revised    : 2006-10-16   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Generalized stack.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 This process stacks traces into a pre-defined 3D volume.  The traces need not
 be sorted into any particular order.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author     Description
     ----        ------     -----------
003. 2006-10-16  D. Glover  Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
  2. 2005-01-31  stoectr    Modified to speed up by factor of two by
                             replacing temptbuffer with temptcache, which
                             does less trace array copying; added test to
                             insure trace buffer memory usage is not too large.
  1. 2004-11-30  stoectr    Initial version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
